text: On tap at "na 7.schode", Zilina. Pours is cloudy amber with thick white head. Aroma of butter, bisquits, caramel, floral. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, light acidic notes, caramel mouthfeel. Medium body, flat carbonation. Decent.

PET láhev 1500 ml. Aroma je výrazně chmelové s jemným nádechem zrajícího sýra a výrazným podkladem sladu a karamelu.Pěna je zlato bílá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je jiskrně měděná. Chuť je výrazná, karamelová s nádechem přezrálého ovoce, fini je výrazně hořký a drící. V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jedná se o zajímavý ale který bych svou chutí zařadil spíe do stylu bitter.
Tap at Richtar Jakub.  Dark amber color with medium off-white head. Hoppy aroma. Malty base, followed by solid hoppy kick. Good.

Draught at Zly Casy, Prague. Clear golden/amber beer with a quite nice beige head. Hoppy citrus aroma, grapes, hay, spicy notes, pepper, floral notes. Hoppy grassy flavor, spicy, hay, pepper, citrus, bready notes. Hoppy floral finish with citrus and grass.

draught at Zly Casy. Hazy amber-brown colour, creamy off-white to beige head. Very "American" hop nose. Full-bodied, good malty base with a touch of caramel that supports the fruity hops very well. Bitter-sweet, almost IPA-like. Smooth palate. All in all a very nice experience.

Bottle from Maria, Kraków. In short, this beer has an English feel with an American punch. Pronounced caramelly malty base, apple esters, citrusy and floral hops. Quite a full body, the maltiness is apparent and very pleasant. Strong bitterness with resiny and citrusy notes, although some earthy hints are also present, meaning there could also be some English hops in there. Creamy mouthfeel. Would be even better if it wasnt slightly oxidised. A great crossover ale!
Hazy dark pale color with small head. Sweet aroma with low hops, probably a single hop with simcoe. Taste is earthy, burn, grassy. Too much burn. Light body, thick texture and flat carbonation.

On tap and Zly Casy in Prague poured into a pint glass.
Hazy deep copper color with a small white head.
Hoppy nose - Herbal and spicy with some garlic and light caramel.
Earthy flavors, marmalade and mellow malt with medium bitterness.
Medium bodied, not malty enough but OK.
On tap at Chameleon. Pours cloudy dark amber with nice tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hint of English hops. Flavor is malty, very distinct English hops, caramel. Nice bittersweet aftertaste.
On tap, Zly Casy, Prague, Nusle, 2012/11/01. Lóalátét. Szalma. Tejszín. Ennyi.
Keg at Zly Casy. Amber with a white head. Very hop forward. Sharp and zesty citrus and a lasting bitterness. Pretty decent.

on tap at zly casy. a rich darker shade of amber with a lingering off-white head; doughy aroma hinting at caramelised tropical fruit; quite a punchy flavour with plenty of zesty hop character and a good whack of bitterness. picked me up a bit near the end of a hectic day of tasting

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2014 Colour hazy darker amber. Small off-white head. Aroma unexpected fruity, almost no hops. Later floral hops aroma. Taste light heavy hoppy bitter, medium malty sweet. Finish muddy grassy medium bitter. 6 4 7 4 14 Rerate at RJ. Aroma mostly hoppy, with light malty background. I get fruits, undiscernable. Almost all of them, in a good way. Taste is initially balanced. Moderate bitterness. Gets more bitter towards finish, maltiness vanishes, leaving fruity hoppy aftertaste. One of the better czech ales, hops being overally fruit-forward.
1.5l bottle. Very good ale. Fruity tones in taste and palate, nice aroma, good head.
